intro: Saussurea × iwateyamensis, commonly known as the Iwate yamensis, is a hybrid perennial plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and large, showy composite flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and is adapted to cool, moist environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
